section.name: s1
section.content: The amount to be determined by the management committee under section 21(1) shall be based upon a budget prepared by the management committee for the period specified by the management committee under that subsection.

section.name: s2
section.content: The budget referred to in paragraph 1 shall set out the sums which in the opinion of the management committee will be reasonably necessary to meet payments of the kind specified in section 20(1) and shall, if a contingency fund is established under section 20(2), set out the sums which in the opinion of the management committee will be reasonably necessary to meet payments of the kind specified in that subsection.

section.name: s3
section.content: A revised budget may be prepared if the management committee is of the opinion that any sum set out in a budget in respect of which the revised budget is to be prepared is insufficient to meet the proposed expenditure which that sum was intended to meet.

subsection.content: Subject to subparagraph (3), if a specified person requests, in writing, the corporation to supply the specified person with a copy of a budget referred to in this Schedule, the management committee must supply the specified person with the copy within 28 days after the date on which the request is made.

subsection.leadIn: The management committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may impose a reasonable copying charge for supplying the specified person with the copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not impose any charge for supplying the specified person with the copy in electronic form.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request mentioned in subparagraph (1) is a request for a copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the management committee imposes under subparagraph (2)(a) a copying charge for supplying the specified person with the copy,

subsection.continued: the management committee is not required to comply with the request unless the specified person pays the charge.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority or an authorized officer requests, in writing, the corporation to supply the Authority or officer with a copy of a budget referred to in this Schedule, the management committee must supply the Authority or officer with the copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without imposing any charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 28 days after the date on which the request is made.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)an owner;(b)the tenants’ representative;(c)a registered mortgagee; or(d)any person duly authorized in writing by an owner or registered mortgagee to make a request mentioned in subparagraph (1).

section.name: s1A
section.leadIn: The management committee shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the written request of not less than 5% of the owners, permit those owners or any person appointed by those owners to inspect any bills, invoices, vouchers, receipts or other documents referred to in section 27(6) at any reasonable time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permit any person authorized by the court to inspect any bills, invoices, vouchers, receipts or other documents referred to in section 27(6) at any reasonable time.

section.name: s1B
section.content: For the purposes of paragraph 1A(b), an owner may apply to the court for an order authorizing the owner, or any other person named in the application, to inspect any bills, invoices, vouchers, receipts or other documents referred to in section 27(6).

section.name: s1C
section.leadIn: The court may make an order under paragraph 1B only if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application is made in good faith; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the inspection applied for is for a proper purpose.

section.name: s2
section.content: Within 1 month after each consecutive period of 3 months, or such shorter period as the management committee may select, the treasurer shall prepare a summary of the income and expenditure of the corporation in respect of that period, display a copy of the summary in a prominent place in the building, and cause it to remain so displayed for at least 7 consecutive days.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subparagraph (3), if a specified person requests, in writing, the corporation to supply the specified person with a copy of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any financial statements and, if applicable, accountant’s report prepared under section 27; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a summary of the income and expenditure of the corporation prepared under paragraph 2,

subsection.continued: the management committee must supply the specified person with the copy within 28 days after the date on which the request is made.

subsection.leadIn: The management committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may impose a reasonable copying charge for supplying the specified person with the copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not impose any charge for supplying the specified person with the copy in electronic form.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request mentioned in subparagraph (1) is a request for a copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the management committee imposes under subparagraph (2)(a) a copying charge for supplying the specified person with the copy,

subsection.continued: the management committee is not required to comply with the request unless the specified person pays the charge.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority or an authorized officer requests, in writing, the corporation to supply the Authority or officer with a copy of any document mentioned in subparagraph (1), the management committee must supply the Authority or officer with the copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without imposing any charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 28 days after the date on which the request is made.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)an owner;(b)the tenants’ representative;(c)a registered mortgagee; or(d)any person duly authorized in writing by an owner or registered mortgagee to make a request mentioned in subparagraph (1).

schedule.name: sch6A
schedule.heading: Requirements for Tendering Specified for Subdivision 2 of Division 5 of Part IV

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation (Schedule 6A)
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: deadline (入標期限), in relation to the submission of a tender for any procurement, means the time after which the submission may no longer be made under—(a)subject to sub-subparagraph (b), the terms of the invitation to tender issued for the procurement; or(b)if the invitation is revised—the terms of the revised invitation issued for the procurement.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Content of invitation to tender

subsection.leadIn: An invitation to tender issued for the procurement must set out clearly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the supplies, goods or services to which the procurement relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specified time on a specified day after which a tender may no longer be submitted for the procurement.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, subparagraph (1)(b) does not prevent the invitation to tender from containing any terms in respect of a postponement, for reasons such as inclement weather, of the time after which a tender may no longer be submitted for the procurement.
In this paragraph, a reference to an invitation to tender issued for the procurement includes, if applicable, any revised invitation to tender issued for the procurement.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Display of copy of invitation to tender

subsection.content: If an invitation to tender is issued for the procurement, the management committee must display a copy of the invitation in a prominent place in the building as soon as reasonably practicable after the invitation is issued, and cause it to remain so displayed until the deadline for the submission of a tender for the procurement.

subsection.leadIn: If a revised invitation to tender is issued for the procurement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement under this paragraph to cause a copy of the previous version of the invitation to remain displayed in a prominent place in the building ceases to apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the management committee must display a copy of the revised invitation in a prominent place in the building as soon as reasonably practicable after the revised invitation is issued, and cause it to remain so displayed until the deadline for the submission of a tender for the procurement.

section.name: s4
section.heading: No acceptance of tender submitted after deadline
section.content: Any tender submitted for the procurement after the deadline must not be accepted.

section.name: s5
section.heading: No acceptance of tender without approval under certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subparagraph (4), no tender may be accepted for the procurement if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procurement is the procurement of any supplies, goods or services the value of which exceeds, or is likely to exceed, $200,000, and an invitation to tender has not been specifically issued to 5 or more potential suppliers for the procurement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the procurement is the procurement of any supplies, goods or services the value of which—

subparagraph.content: exceeds, or is likely to exceed, $10,000; but
does not exceed, or is unlikely to exceed, $200,000,

paragraph.continued: and an invitation to tender has not been specifically issued to 3 or more potential suppliers for the procurement.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subparagraph (1), an invitation to tender is specifically issued to a person if it is issued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering a copy of the invitation in hard copy form personally to the person;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: by sending validly a copy of the invitation in electronic form to the person.

subsection.content: Subparagraph (1) applies regardless of whether an invitation to tender issued for the procurement is advertised (such as in a local newspaper or on a website) and is open to any potential suppliers.

subsection.leadIn: Subparagraph (1) does not have any effect in relation to the procurement if it is so decided by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the procurement is type 1 high-value procurement—a management committee resolution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the procurement is type 2 high-value procurement or large-scale maintenance procurement—a corporation resolution.

subsection.content: In this paragraph, a reference to an invitation to tender issued for the procurement includes, if applicable, any revised invitation to tender issued for the procurement.

schedule.name: sch6B
schedule.heading: Requirements Relating to Declarations Specified for Subdivision 2 of Division 5 of Part IV

part.name: P1
part.heading: Declarations of Interests or Connections etc. and Related Restrictions for Type 1 High-value Procurement, Type 2 High-value Procurement and Large-scale Maintenance Procurement

division.name: D1
division.heading: Declarations by Participants of Management Committee

section.name: s1
section.heading: Declarations of interests or connections for tenders submitted, etc.

subsection.content: If a participant of the management committee becomes aware that, before a contract is entered into for the procurement, the participant has any pecuniary or other personal interest in a tender submitted for the procurement, the participant must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming so aware, declare the interest in accordance with paragraphs 2 and 3.

If a participant of the management committee becomes aware that, before a contract is entered into for the procurement, the participant has any connection with a person who has submitted a tender for the procurement, the participant must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming so aware, declare the connection in accordance with paragraphs 2 and 3.

subsection.leadIn: If the procurement is conducted in the circumstances described in section 28D(3) or 28E(3), then for the purposes of this paragraph—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reference to a tender submitted for the procurement in subparagraph (1) is to be construed as a reference to the procurement of supplies, goods or services from the specified supplier; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference to a person who has submitted a tender for the procurement in subparagraph (2) is to be construed as a reference to the specified supplier.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified supplier (指明供應商), in relation to the procurement of any supplies, goods or services conducted in the circumstances described in section 28D(3) or 28E(3), means the supplier from whom the supplies, goods or services are to be procured under the decision mentioned in that section.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Form of declarations

subsection.content: The declaration must be made in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: If a person who makes the declaration is a body corporate, then despite anything to the contrary in its constitution, the declaration must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impressed with its seal or chop; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: signed by a person authorized by it in that behalf.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Persons to whom declarations are made

subsection.leadIn: The declaration must be made to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to sub-subparagraph (b)—

subparagraph.content: if the person who makes the declaration (declarant) is neither the chairman nor secretary of the management committee—the chairman or secretary of the management committee;
if the declarant is the secretary of the management committee—the chairman of the management committee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if making the declaration under sub-subparagraph (a) is impracticable for reasons such as vacancy in an office—every member of the management committee (not including the declarant).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this paragraph, a declaration is made to a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the declaration in hard copy form (whether being the original copy or otherwise) is lodged with the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the declaration in electronic form is sent validly to the person.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Display of notice of declarations

subsection.content: If a declaration under paragraph 1 has been made, the management committee must display a notice of the declaration that complies with subparagraph (2) in a prominent place in the building within 7 days after the date on which the declaration is made, and cause it to remain so displayed for at least 7 consecutive days.

subsection.leadIn: The notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must identify the procurement and tender concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must specify whether the person who made the declaration assumes a particular office of the management committee and, if so, which office; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must contain a statement indicating the right to inspect a copy of the declaration under paragraph 6(2).

subsection.content: If a declaration is made to different members of the management committee as required by paragraph 3(1)(b) and is so made on different dates, then for the purposes of subparagraph (1), the last such date is taken to be the date on which the declaration is made.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Specific meeting procedure relating to declarations

subsection.leadIn: If a declaration under paragraph 1 has been made, the management committee must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the declaration is produced to the management committee at the first procurement meeting since the making of the declaration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of a notice mentioned in paragraph 4(1) is attached to the minutes of the proceedings at the meeting kept under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Subparagraph (1) does not limit Schedule 2 in relation to the procedure at a meeting of a management committee convened under that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: procurement meeting (採購會議), in relation to a declaration, means a meeting of the management committee convened under Schedule 2 that concerns the relevant procurement.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Keeping of and permitting inspection of declarations

subsection.content: If a declaration under paragraph 1 has been made in relation to the procurement, the management committee must, during the period of 6 years after the date on which a contract is entered into for the procurement, keep a copy of the declaration.
The management committee must permit a specified person to inspect the copy at any reasonable time.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)the Authority;(b)an authorized officer;(c)an owner;(d)the tenants’ representative;(e)a registered mortgagee; or(f)any person duly authorized in writing by an owner or registered mortgagee to conduct an inspection mentioned in subparagraph (2).

section.name: s7
section.heading: Prohibition from attending meetings of management committee

subsection.leadIn: A person who has made a declaration under paragraph 1 in relation to the procurement (declarant)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not preside over or otherwise attend a meeting of the management committee convened under Schedule 2 to the extent that it concerns the procurement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be counted toward the quorum at the meeting to that extent.

subsection.content: If a declarant is absent from a meeting in compliance with subparagraph (1), the person presiding over the meeting must ensure that the minutes of the proceedings at the meeting kept under this Ordinance (meeting minutes) contain a record of the fact that the declarant is so absent.

subsection.leadIn: A declarant is exempt from subparagraph (1)(a) if it is so decided by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a management committee resolution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a corporation resolution,

subsection.continued: but even so the declarant must neither vote on any proposed resolution of the management committee concerning the procurement at the meeting of the management committee, nor be present at the meeting when the proposed resolution is being voted on.

subsection.content: A resolution for exempting a declarant under subparagraph (3) (exemption resolution) must not be proposed at a meeting unless the reasons for proposing the resolution are given at the meeting.
The person presiding over a meeting at which an exemption resolution is proposed must ensure that the meeting minutes contain the reasons mentioned in subparagraph (4).
A declarant must not vote on any proposed exemption resolution concerning the procurement.

In the event of an inconsistency between a management committee resolution, and a corporation resolution, mentioned in subparagraph (3), the corporation resolution prevails to the extent of the inconsistency.

If a declarant is the secretary of the management committee (original secretary), the management committee must appoint another person to act as the secretary of the management committee for the duration for which the original secretary is absent from a meeting in compliance with subparagraph (1).

subsection.leadIn: This paragraph—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not limit Schedule 2 in relation to the procedure at a meeting of a management committee convened under that Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not limit Schedule 3 or 6C in relation to the procedure at a general meeting of a corporation convened under Schedule 3.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Prohibition from participating in procurement activities
section.content: A person who has made a declaration under paragraph 1 in relation to the procurement must not participate in any assessment of tenders submitted for the procurement or any negotiation or other activity relating to the procurement.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Declarations of dealings or connections with members of management committee

subsection.content: If a responsible person for the procurement becomes aware that, after the initiation decision is made for the procurement but before a contract is entered into for it, the responsible person has any pecuniary or other personal dealing with a member of the management committee, the responsible person must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming so aware, declare the dealing in accordance with paragraphs 11 and 12.

If a responsible person for the procurement becomes aware that, after the initiation decision is made for the procurement but before a contract is entered into for it, the responsible person has any connection with a member of the management committee, the responsible person must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming so aware, declare the connection in accordance with paragraphs 11 and 12.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Declarations of interests or connections for tenders submitted, etc.

subsection.content: If a responsible person for the procurement becomes aware that, before a contract is entered into for the procurement, the responsible person has any pecuniary or other personal interest in a tender submitted for the procurement, the responsible person must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming so aware, declare the interest in accordance with paragraphs 11 and 12.

If a responsible person for the procurement becomes aware that, before a contract is entered into for the procurement, the responsible person has any connection with a person who has submitted a tender for the procurement, the responsible person must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming so aware, declare the connection in accordance with paragraphs 11 and 12.

subsection.leadIn: If the procurement is conducted in the circumstances described in section 28D(3) or 28E(3), then for the purposes of this paragraph—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reference to a tender submitted for the procurement in subparagraph (1) is to be construed as a reference to the procurement of supplies, goods or services from the specified supplier; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference to a person who has submitted a tender for the procurement in subparagraph (2) is to be construed as a reference to the specified supplier.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified supplier (指明供應商), in relation to the procurement of any supplies, goods or services conducted in the circumstances described in section 28D(3) or 28E(3), means the supplier from whom the supplies, goods or services are to be procured under the decision mentioned in that section.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Form of declarations

subsection.content: The declaration must be made in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: If a person who makes the declaration is a body corporate, then despite anything to the contrary in its constitution, the declaration must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impressed with its seal or chop; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: signed by a person authorized by it in that behalf.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Persons to whom declarations are made

subsection.leadIn: The declaration must be made to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to sub-subparagraph (b), the chairman or secretary of the management committee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if making the declaration under sub-subparagraph (a) is impracticable for reasons such as vacancy in an office—every member of the management committee.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this paragraph, a declaration is made to a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the declaration in hard copy form (whether being the original copy or otherwise) is lodged with the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the declaration in electronic form is sent validly to the person.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Display of notice of declarations

subsection.content: If a declaration under paragraph 9 or 10 has been made, the management committee must display a notice of the declaration that complies with subparagraph (2) in a prominent place in the building within 7 days after the date on which the declaration is made, and cause it to remain so displayed for at least 7 consecutive days.

subsection.leadIn: The notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must identify—

subparagraph.content: the procurement concerned and, for a declaration under paragraph 10, the tender concerned; and
the person who made the declaration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must specify in which of the following capacities the person made the declaration—

subparagraph.content: the manager of the building;
a person who is accustomed or obliged to act in accordance with the directions or instructions of the manager in connection with substantive matters in respect of the procurement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must contain a statement indicating the right to inspect a copy of the declaration under paragraph 15(2).

subsection.content: If a declaration is made to different members of the management committee as required by paragraph 12(1)(b) and is so made on different dates, then for the purposes of subparagraph (1), the last such date is taken to be the date on which the declaration is made.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Specific meeting procedure relating to declarations

subsection.leadIn: If a declaration under paragraph 9 or 10 has been made, the management committee must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the declaration is produced to the management committee at the first procurement meeting since the making of the declaration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of a notice mentioned in paragraph 13(1) is attached to the minutes of the proceedings at the meeting kept under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Subparagraph (1) does not limit Schedule 2 in relation to the procedure at a meeting of a management committee convened under that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: procurement meeting (採購會議), in relation to a declaration, means a meeting of the management committee convened under Schedule 2 that concerns the relevant procurement.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Keeping of and permitting inspection of declarations

subsection.content: If a declaration under paragraph 9 or 10 has been made in relation to the procurement, the management committee must, during the period of 6 years after the date on which a contract is entered into for the procurement, keep a copy of the declaration.
The management committee must permit a specified person to inspect the copy at any reasonable time.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)the Authority;(b)an authorized officer;(c)an owner;(d)the tenants’ representative;(e)a registered mortgagee; or(f)any person duly authorized in writing by an owner or registered mortgagee to conduct an inspection mentioned in subparagraph (2).

section.name: s16
section.heading: Prohibition from participating in procurement activities

subsection.content: A person who has made a declaration under paragraph 9 or 10 in relation to the procurement must not participate in any assessment of tenders submitted for the procurement or any negotiation or other activity relating to the procurement.

subsection.leadIn: A person mentioned in subparagraph (1) is exempt from that subparagraph if it is so decided by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a management committee resolution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a corporation resolution.

subsection.content: A resolution for exempting a person under subparagraph (2) (exemption resolution) must not be proposed at a meeting unless the reasons for proposing the resolution are given at the meeting.

The person presiding over a meeting at which an exemption resolution is proposed must ensure that the minutes of the proceedings at the meeting kept under this Ordinance contain the reasons mentioned in subparagraph (3).

In the event of an inconsistency between a management committee resolution, and a corporation resolution, mentioned in subparagraph (2), the corporation resolution prevails to the extent of the inconsistency.

subsection.leadIn: This paragraph—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not limit Schedule 2 in relation to the procedure at a meeting of a management committee convened under that Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not limit Schedule 3 or 6C in relation to the procedure at a general meeting of a corporation convened under Schedule 3.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Declarations of No Interest or Connection for Large-scale Maintenance Procurement

division.name: D1
division.heading: Declarations by Participants of Management Committee

section.name: s17
section.heading: Declaration of no interest or connection for tenders submitted
section.leadIn: If any tender has been submitted for the large-scale maintenance procurement, every participant of the management committee must, before the first tender acceptance meeting is held, declare in accordance with paragraphs 18 and 19—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the participant, as at the date of the declaration—

subparagraph.content: if the participant has declared an interest under paragraph 1(1) in respect of the tender—does not have any pecuniary or other personal interest in the tender except for the interest so declared; or
in any other case—does not have any pecuniary or other personal interest in the tender; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the participant, as at the date of the declaration—

subparagraph.content: if the participant has declared a connection under paragraph 1(2) in respect of the tender—does not have any connection with a person who has submitted the tender except for the connection so declared; or
in any other case—does not have any connection with a person who has submitted the tender.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: signed by a person authorized by it in that behalf.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Persons to whom declarations are made

subsection.leadIn: The declaration must be made to—

paragraph.leadIn: subject to sub-subparagraph (b)—

subparagraph.content: if the person who makes the declaration (declarant) is neither the chairman nor secretary of the management committee—the chairman or secretary of the management committee;
if the declarant is the secretary of the management committee—the chairman of the management committee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if making the declaration under sub-subparagraph (a) is impracticable for reasons such as vacancy in an office—every member of the management committee (not including the declarant).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this paragraph, a declaration is made to a person if—

paragraph.name: a

section.name: s20
section.heading: Specific meeting procedure relating to declarations for first tender acceptance meeting

subsection.content: For every declaration that has been made under paragraph 17, the management committee must ensure that a document in respect of the declaration that complies with subparagraph (2) is attached to the minutes of the proceedings at the first tender acceptance meeting kept under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The document—

subsection.content: Subparagraph (1) does not limit Schedule 3 or 6C in relation to the procedure at a general meeting of a corporation convened under Schedule 3.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Keeping of and permitting inspection of declarations

The management committee must permit a specified person to inspect the copy at any reasonable time.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Declaration of no dealing or connection with members of management committee
section.leadIn: If the initiation decision has been made for the large-scale maintenance procurement, every responsible person for the procurement must, before the first tender acceptance meeting is held, declare in accordance with paragraphs 24 and 25—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the responsible person, as at the date of the declaration—

subparagraph.content: if the responsible person has declared a dealing under paragraph 9(1)—does not have any pecuniary or other personal dealing with a member of the management committee except for the dealing so declared; or
in any other case—does not have any pecuniary or other personal dealing with a member of the management committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the responsible person, as at the date of the declaration—

subparagraph.content: if the responsible person has declared a connection under paragraph 9(2)—does not have any connection with a member of the management committee except for the connection so declared; or
in any other case—does not have any connection with a member of the management committee.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the responsible person, as at the date of the declaration—

in any other case—does not have any connection with a person who has submitted the tender.

section.heading: Specific meeting procedure relating to declarations for first tender acceptance meeting

subsection.content: For every declaration that has been made under paragraph 22 or 23, the management committee must ensure that a document in respect of the declaration that complies with subparagraph (2) is attached to the minutes of the proceedings at the first tender acceptance meeting kept under this Ordinance.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Keeping of and permitting inspection of declarations

subsection.content: If a declaration under paragraph 22 or 23 has been made in relation to the large-scale maintenance procurement, the management committee must, during the period of 6 years after the date on which a contract is entered into for the procurement, keep a copy of the declaration.

schedule.name: sch6C
schedule.heading: Specific Procedure at General Meetings of Corporations Concerning Large-scale Maintenance Procurement

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation (Schedule 6C)

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule, a reference to a meeting of a corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a reference to a general meeting of the corporation convened under Schedule 3; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a meeting mentioned in sub-subparagraph (a) is adjourned—includes the adjourned meeting.

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule, a reference to a proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution is a reference to a proposed resolution of the owners for deciding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a tender submitted for any large-scale maintenance procurement is to be accepted or not; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether a contract entered into for any large-scale maintenance procurement—

subparagraph.content: is to be varied or not;
is to be terminated or not; or
is to be avoided under section 28I(1)(b) or not.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Schedule 3 not limited unless inconsistent
section.content: This Schedule does not limit Schedule 3 in relation to the procedure at a meeting of a corporation to the extent that Schedule 3 is consistent with this Schedule.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Notices of meeting

subsection.content: If a resolution that is to be proposed at a meeting of a corporation is a proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution, the statement in the notice of the meeting specifying the proposed resolution for compliance with paragraph 2(1AA)(b) of Schedule 3 must be titled “Important Reminder” in English and “重要提示” in Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: If the proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution concerns the question mentioned in paragraph 1(2)(a), the notice of the meeting must, in relation to each tender that is valid under the terms of the relevant invitation to tender, set out clearly and legibly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the estimated amount to be contributed from each building management fund for the procurement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the estimated apportioned amount that each of the owners is to contribute for the procurement in addition to a contribution mentioned in sub-subparagraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: If the proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution concerns a question mentioned in paragraph 1(2)(b) and the corporation or the owners (or both of the corporation and the owners) are expected to incur any financial liability (including legal costs) because of the relevant variation, termination or avoidance of contract, the notice of the meeting must set out clearly and legibly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the estimated amount to be contributed from each building management fund for settling the costs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the estimated apportioned amount that each of the owners is to contribute for settling the costs in addition to a contribution mentioned in sub-subparagraph (a).

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, even if the estimated amount mentioned in subparagraph (2) or (3) is zero, that subparagraph does require such an amount to be set out in accordance with that subparagraph.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: building management fund (建築物管理基金) means—(a)a general fund established and maintained by the corporation under section 20(1);(b)a contingency fund established and maintained by the corporation under section 20(2);(c)a special fund established and maintained by the manager of the building under the mandatory DMC terms contained in paragraph 4(1) of Schedule 7; or(d)any fund other than the special fund that is established and maintained by the manager of the building for performing a function under the deed of mutual covenant or this Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Voting-in-person threshold

subsection.content: The voting in respect of a proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution at a meeting of a corporation is subject to a voting-in-person threshold specified under subparagraph (2).

subsection.leadIn: The voting-in-person threshold is the lesser of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 5% of the owners; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 100 owners.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Recording of votes cast personally and by proxy
section.leadIn: If votes have been cast for a proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution at a meeting of a corporation, the person presiding over the meeting must not certify the minutes of the proceedings at the meeting under paragraph 6(2) of Schedule 3 unless the person is satisfied that the minutes contain a clear and legible record of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total number of such votes cast personally; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total number of such votes cast by proxy.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Supply of copies of minutes of proceedings at meetings

subsection.content: This paragraph applies if a proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution is considered at a meeting of a corporation.

subsection.leadIn: The management committee must, within 28 days after the date of the meeting, supply each of the owners and the tenants’ representative (if any) (recipient) with a copy of the certified minutes for the meeting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering a copy of the minutes in hard copy form personally to the recipient;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending a copy of the minutes in hard copy form by post to the recipient at the recipient’s last known address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by leaving a copy of the minutes in hard copy form at the recipient’s flat or depositing such a copy in the letter box for that flat; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by sending validly a copy of the minutes in electronic form to the recipient.

schedule.name: sch7
schedule.heading: Mandatory Terms in Deeds of Mutual Covenant

section.name: s1
section.heading: Determination of total amount of management expenses

subsection.content: Subject to subparagraphs (3), (5), (6) and (8), the total amount of management expenses payable by the owners during any period of 12 months adopted by the manager of a building as the financial year in respect of the management of that building shall be the total proposed expenditure during that year as specified by the manager in accordance with subparagraph (2).

subsection.leadIn: In respect of each financial year, the manager shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prepare a draft budget setting out the proposed expenditure during the financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send a copy of the draft budget to the owners’ committee or, where there is no owners’ committee, display a copy of the draft budget in a prominent place in the building, and cause it to remain so displayed for at least 7 consecutive days; (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 32)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: send or display, as the case may be, with the copy of the draft budget a notice inviting each owner to send his comments on the draft budget to the manager within a period of 14 days from the date the draft budget was sent or first displayed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: after the end of that period, prepare a budget specifying the total proposed expenditure during the financial year;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: send a copy of the budget to the owners’ committee or, where there is no owners’ committee, display a copy of the budget in a prominent place in the building, and cause it to remain so displayed for at least 7 consecutive days. (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 32)

subsection.leadIn: Where, in respect of a financial year, the manager has not complied with subparagraph (2) before the start of that financial year, the total amount of the management expenses for that year shall—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: when he has so complied, be the total proposed expenditure specified in the budget for that financial year, and the amount that the owners shall contribute towards the management expenses shall be calculated and adjusted accordingly.

subsection.content: Where a budget has been sent or displayed in accordance with subparagraph (2)(e) and the manager wishes to revise it, he shall follow the same procedures in respect of the revised budget as apply to the draft budget and budget by virtue of subparagraph (2).

Where a revised budget is sent or displayed in accordance with subparagraph (4), the total amount of the management expenses for that financial year shall be the total expenditure or proposed expenditure specified in the revised budget and the amount that owners shall contribute towards the management expenses shall be calculated and adjusted accordingly.

If there is a corporation and, within a period of 1 month from the date that a budget or revised budget for a financial year is sent or first displayed in accordance with subparagraph (2) or (4), the corporation decides, by a corporation resolution, to reject the budget or revised budget, as the case may be, the total amount of management expenses for the financial year shall, until another budget or revised budget is sent or displayed in accordance with subparagraph (2) or (4) and is not so rejected under this subparagraph, be deemed to be the same as the total amount of management expenses (if any) for the previous financial year, together with an amount not exceeding 10% of that total amount as the manager may determine. (Amended 20 of 2024 s. 43)

Subject to subparagraph (7B), if an owner requests, in writing, the manager to supply the owner with a copy of any draft budget, budget or revised budget, the manager must supply the owner with the copy within 28 days after the date on which the request is made. (Replaced 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.name: 7A
subsection.leadIn: The manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may impose a reasonable copying charge for supplying the owner with the copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not impose any charge for supplying the owner with the copy in electronic form. (Added 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.name: 7B
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request mentioned in subparagraph (7) is a request for a copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manager imposes under subparagraph (7A)(a) a copying charge for supplying the owner with the copy,

subsection.continued: the manager is not required to comply with the request unless the owner pays the charge. (Added 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.def: For the purposes of this paragraph, expenditure (開支) includes all costs, charges and expenses to be borne by the owners, including the remuneration of the manager.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Keeping of accounts

subsection.content: The manager shall maintain proper books or records of account and other financial records and shall keep all bills, invoices, vouchers, receipts and other documents referred to in those books and records for at least 6 years.

Within 1 month after each consecutive period of 3 months, or such shorter period as the manager may select, the manager shall prepare a summary of income and expenditure and a balance sheet in respect of that period, display a copy of the summary and balance sheet in a prominent place in the building, and cause it to remain so displayed for at least 7 consecutive days. (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 32)
The manager must prepare an income and expenditure account and balance sheet (financial statements) for each financial year. (Replaced 20 of 2024 s. 43)

Each set of financial statements prepared under subparagraph (3) must include details of the special fund required by paragraph 4 and an estimate of the time when there will be a need to draw on that fund, and the amount of money that will be then needed. (Amended 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: Any summary, balance sheet or income and expenditure account prepared under this paragraph must be signed by the manager. (Added 20 of 2024 s. 43)

Any financial statements prepared under subparagraph (3) must be properly audited if either the total income or total expenditure contained in the income and expenditure account, or both of them, exceed or are likely to exceed the monetary amount specified in section 27(2)(c). (Replaced 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subparagraph (6), any financial statements are properly audited if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial statements are audited by an accountant approved by an owners resolution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the accountant reports for the audit under sub-subparagraph (a) as to whether the financial statements are, in the accountant’s opinion, properly prepared so as to give a true and fair view of—

subparagraph.content: the financial transactions in respect of the management of the building for the period to which the income and expenditure account relates; and
the financial position in respect of the management of the building as at the date to which the income and expenditure account is made up,

paragraph.continued: subject to any qualification that the accountant thinks fit. (Added 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.name: 6B
subsection.leadIn: If any financial statements are prepared under subparagraph (3), the manager must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the financial statements are required by subparagraph (6) to be audited—display a copy of the financial statements and a copy of the accountant’s report in respect of the audit in a prominent place in the building as soon as reasonably practicable after the manager obtains the report from the accountant, and cause them to remain so displayed for at least 7 consecutive days; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—display a copy of the financial statements in a prominent place in the building as soon as reasonably practicable after the statements are signed in accordance with subparagraph (4A), and cause it to remain so displayed for at least 7 consecutive days. (Added 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.name: 6C
subsection.content: The manager must permit a specified person to inspect any accounting document at any reasonable time. (Added 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.name: 6D
subsection.content: Subject to subparagraph (6F), if a specified person requests, in writing, the manager to supply the specified person with a copy of any accounting document, the manager must supply the specified person with the copy within 28 days after the date on which the request is made. (Added 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.name: 6E
subsection.leadIn: The manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may impose a reasonable copying charge for supplying the specified person with the copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not impose any charge for supplying the specified person with the copy in electronic form. (Added 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.name: 6F
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request mentioned in subparagraph (6D) is a request for a copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manager imposes under subparagraph (6E)(a) a copying charge for supplying the specified person with the copy,

subsection.continued: the manager is not required to comply with the request unless the specified person pays the charge. (Added 20 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.content: The financial year may not be changed more than once in every 5 years, unless that change is previously approved by a resolution of the owners’ committee (if any).

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)an owner;(b)a registered mortgagee; or(c)any person duly authorized in writing by an owner or registered mortgagee to conduct an inspection mentioned in subparagraph (6C). (Added 20 of 2024 s. 43)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Manager to open and maintain bank account

subsection.content: The manager shall open and maintain an interest-bearing account and shall use that account exclusively in respect of the management of the building. (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 32)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of subparagraph (1), if there is a corporation, the manager shall open and maintain one or more segregated interest-bearing accounts, each of which shall be designated as a trust account or client account, for holding money received by him from or on behalf of the corporation in respect of the management of the building. (Added 5 of 2007 s. 32)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The manager shall display a document showing evidence of any account opened and maintained under subparagraph (1) or (1A) in a prominent place in the building. (Added 5 of 2007 s. 32)

Subject to subparagraphs (3) and (4), the manager shall without delay pay all money received by him in respect of the management of the building into the account opened and maintained under subparagraph (1) or, if there is a corporation, the account or accounts opened and maintained under subparagraph (1A). (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 32)

Subject to subparagraph (4), the manager may, out of money received by him in respect of the management of the building, retain or pay into a current account a reasonable amount to cover expenditure of a minor nature, but that amount shall not exceed such figure as is determined from time to time by a resolution of the owners’ committee (if any).

The retention of a reasonable amount of money under subparagraph (3) or the payment of that amount into a current account in accordance with that subparagraph and any other arrangement for dealing with money received by the manager shall be subject to such conditions as may be approved by a resolution of the owners’ committee (if any).

Any reference in this paragraph to an account is a reference to an account opened with a bank within the meaning of section 2 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), the title of which refers to the management of the building. (Amended 49 of 1995 s. 53)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Special fund

subsection.content: The manager shall establish and maintain a special fund to provide for expenditure of a kind not expected by him to be incurred annually.

If there is a corporation, the corporation shall determine, by a corporation resolution, the amount to be contributed to the special fund by the owners in any financial year, and the time when those contributions shall be payable. (Amended 20 of 2024 s. 43)

The manager shall open and maintain at a bank within the meaning of section 2 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) an interest-bearing account, the title of which shall refer to the special fund for the building, and shall use that account exclusively for the purpose referred to in subparagraph (1). (Amended 49 of 1995 s. 53; 5 of 2007 s. 32)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of subparagraph (3), if there is a corporation, the manager shall open and maintain one or more segregated interest-bearing accounts, each of which shall be designated as a trust account or client account, for holding money received by him from or on behalf of the corporation in respect of the special fund. (Added 5 of 2007 s. 32)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: The manager shall display a document showing evidence of any account opened and maintained under subparagraph (3) or (3A) in a prominent place in the building. (Added 5 of 2007 s. 32)

The manager shall without delay pay all money received by him in respect of the special fund into the account opened and maintained under subparagraph (3) or, if there is a corporation, the account or accounts opened and maintained under subparagraph (3A). (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 32)

Except in a situation considered by the manager to be an emergency, no money shall be paid out of the special fund unless it is for a purpose approved by a resolution of the owners’ committee (if any).

section.name: s4A
section.heading: Communication among owners
section.leadIn: The manager must, on the channels of communication among owners on any business relating to the management of the building—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if there is a corporation—consult (either generally or in any particular case) the corporation at a general meeting of the corporation convened under Schedule 3 and adopt the approach decided by the corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no corporation—consult (either generally or in any particular case) the owners’ committee at a meeting of owners convened under the deed of mutual covenant and adopt the approach decided by the owners’ committee.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Resignation of manager

subsection.leadIn: No resignation of the manager shall take effect unless he has previously given not less than 3 months’ notice in writing of his intention to resign—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by sending such a notice to the owners’ committee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where there is no owners’ committee, by giving such a notice to each of the owners and by displaying such a notice in a prominent place in the building.

subsection.leadIn: The notice referred to in subparagraph (1)(b) may be given— (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 32)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering it personally to the owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending it by post to the owner at his last known address; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by leaving it at the owner’s flat or depositing it in the letter box for that flat. (Amended 12 of 1998 s. 9)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Termination of manager’s appointment by owners’ corporation

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subparagraph (5A), at a general meeting convened for the purpose, a corporation may, by a resolution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: passed by a majority of the votes of the owners voting either personally or by proxy; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: supported by the owners of not less than 50% of the shares in aggregate,

subsection.continued: terminate by notice the DMC manager’s appointment without compensation. (Replaced 5 of 2007 s. 32)

subsection.leadIn: A resolution under subparagraph (1) shall have effect only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice of termination of appointment is in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provision is made in the resolution for a period of not less than 3 months’ notice or, in lieu of notice, provision is made for an agreement to be made with the DMC manager for the payment to him of a sum equal to the amount of remuneration which would have accrued to him during that period; (Replaced 69 of 2000 s. 25. Amended E.R. 2 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the notice is accompanied by a copy of the resolution terminating the DMC manager’s appointment; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the notice and the copy of the resolution is given to the DMC manager within 14 days after the date of the meeting.

subsection.leadIn: The notice and the copy of the resolution referred to in subparagraph (2)(d) may be given— (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 32)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering them personally to the DMC manager; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending them by post to the DMC manager at his last known address.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subparagraph (1)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the reference in subparagraph (1)(b) to the owners of not less than 50% of the shares in aggregate shall be construed as a reference to the owners of not less than 50% of the shares in aggregate who are entitled to vote. (Added 69 of 2000 s. 25. Amended 5 of 2007 s. 69)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: If a contract for the appointment of a manager other than a DMC manager contains no provision for the termination of the manager’s appointment, subparagraphs (1), (2), (3) and (5A) apply to the termination of the manager’s appointment as they apply to the termination of a DMC manager’s appointment. (Added 5 of 2007 s. 32)

subsection.name: 5C
subsection.content: Subparagraph (5B) operates without prejudice to any other power there may be in a contract for the appointment of a manager other than a DMC manager to terminate the appointment of the manager. (Added 5 of 2007 s. 32)

subsection.leadIn: If a notice to terminate a manager’s appointment is given under this paragraph—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no appointment of a new manager shall take effect unless the appointment is approved by a resolution of the owners’ committee (if any); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no such appointment is approved under sub-subparagraph (a) by the time the notice expires, the corporation may appoint another manager and, if it does so, the corporation shall have exclusive power to appoint any subsequent manager.

subsection.content: If any person has given an undertaking in writing to, or has entered into an agreement with, the Government to manage or be responsible for the management of the building, and the corporation has appointed a manager under subparagraph (6)(b), the corporation shall be deemed to have given to that person an instrument of indemnity under which the corporation shall be liable to indemnify that person in respect of any act or omission by the manager appointed under that subparagraph that may otherwise render that person liable for a breach of that undertaking or agreement.
This paragraph is subject to any notice relating to the building that may be published by the Authority under section 34E(4) but does not apply to any single manager referred to in that section.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Obligations after manager’s appointment ends

subsection.content: Subject to subparagraph (2), if the manager’s appointment ends for any reason, he shall, as soon as practicable after his appointment ends, and in any event within 14 days of the date his appointment ends, deliver to the owners’ committee (if any) or the manager appointed in his place any movable property in respect of the control, management and administration of the building that is under his control or in his custody or possession, and that belongs to the corporation (if any) or the owners. (Added 5 of 2007 s. 32)

subsection.leadIn: If the manager’s appointment ends for any reason, he shall within 2 months of the date his appointment ends— (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 32)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prepare—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an income and expenditure account for the period beginning with the commencement of the financial year in which his appointment ends and ending on the date his appointment ended; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a balance sheet as at the date his appointment ended,

paragraph.continued: and shall arrange for that account and balance sheet to be audited by an accountant or by some other independent auditor specified in a resolution of the owners’ committee (if any) or, in the absence of any such specification, by such accountant or other independent auditor as may be chosen by the manager; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deliver to the owners’ committee (if any) or the manager appointed in his place any books or records of accounts, papers, documents and other records which are required for the purposes of sub-subparagraph (a) and have not been delivered under subparagraph (1). (Replaced 5 of 2007 s. 32)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Procurement of Supplies, Goods or Services

division.name: D1
division.heading: Keeping of and Permitting Inspection of Procurement Documents

section.name: s10
section.heading: Keeping of procurement documents

subsection.content: This paragraph applies if there is no corporation.

If a contract is entered into for the procurement of any supplies, goods or services required by the owners in the performance of a function under the deed of mutual covenant or this Ordinance, the manager must, during the period of 6 years after the date on which the contract is entered into, keep all the procurement documents.

subsection.leadIn: In subparagraph (2)—
subsection.def: procurement document (採購文件), in relation to the procurement of any supplies, goods or services—(a)means a document—(i)that contains information that enables a person who inspects it to (whether with or without any other document) readily verify the financial liability incurred by the owners for the procurement; or(ii)that otherwise relates to the procurement,such as a tender document, copy of contract, statement of account and invoice; and(b)does not include a declaration made under Division 4.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Permitting inspection of procurement documents

subsection.content: The manager must, at the written request of not less than 5% of the owners, permit any of those owners or any person appointed by those owners to inspect, at any reasonable time, any document kept by the manager under paragraph 10(2).

Subject to subparagraph (4), if a person who is permitted under subparagraph (1) to inspect any document (requester) requests, in writing, the manager to supply the requester with a copy of the document, the manager must supply the requester with the copy within 28 days after the date on which the request is made.

subsection.leadIn: The manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may impose a reasonable copying charge for supplying the requester with the copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not impose any charge for supplying the requester with the copy in electronic form.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request mentioned in subparagraph (2) is a request for a copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manager imposes under subparagraph (3)(a) a copying charge for supplying the requester with the copy,

subsection.continued: the manager is not required to comply with the request unless the requester pays the charge.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Specific Requirements for Certain Types of Procurement

section.name: s12
section.heading: Type 1 high-value procurement

subsection.leadIn: The manager must not enter into any contract for any type 1 high-value procurement unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procurement complies with any Code of Practice concerning the procurement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the procurement is conducted by an invitation to tender.

subsection.leadIn: Moreover, if there is no corporation—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the requirements relating to declarations specified in Subdivision 1 of Division 4 must be complied with in relation to the procurement.

subsection.leadIn: However, subparagraphs (1)(b) and (2)(a) do not apply in relation to the procurement if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the supplies, goods or services to which the procurement relates (target supplies, goods or services) are of the same type as any supplies, goods or services that are for the time being supplied by a supplier for the building; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is decided by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if there is a corporation—a corporation resolution; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if there is no corporation—an owners resolution; or
in the case of subparagraph (2)(a)—an owners resolution,

paragraph.continued: that the target supplies, goods or services must be procured from that supplier on the terms and conditions that are specified in the resolution, instead of by an invitation to tender.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Type 2 high-value procurement

subsection.leadIn: The manager must not enter into any contract for any type 2 high-value procurement unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procurement complies with any Code of Practice concerning the procurement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the procurement is conducted by an invitation to tender;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for every tender submitted for the procurement, whether it is accepted or not is decided by—

subparagraph.content: if there is a corporation—a corporation resolution; or
if there is no corporation—an owners resolution; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the contract is entered into with the tenderer whose tender is accepted as decided in the way mentioned in sub-subparagraph (c).

subsection.leadIn: Moreover, if there is no corporation—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the requirements relating to declarations specified in Subdivision 1 of Division 4 must be complied with in relation to the procurement.

subsection.leadIn: However, subparagraphs (1)(b), (c) and (d) and (2)(a) do not apply in relation to the procurement if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the supplies, goods or services to which the procurement relates (target supplies, goods or services) are of the same type as any supplies, goods or services that are for the time being supplied by a supplier for the building; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is decided by—

subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of subparagraph (1)(b), (c) or (d)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if there is a corporation—a corporation resolution; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if there is no corporation—an owners resolution; or
in the case of subparagraph (2)(a)—an owners resolution,

paragraph.continued: that the target supplies, goods or services must be procured from that supplier on the terms and conditions that are specified in the resolution, instead of by an invitation to tender.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything to the contrary in a contract entered into for any type 2 high-value procurement, the manager must not vary or terminate the contract unless the contract is varied or terminated in accordance with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if there is a corporation—a corporation resolution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no corporation—an owners resolution.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Large-scale maintenance procurement

subsection.leadIn: The manager must not enter into any contract for any large-scale maintenance procurement unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procurement complies with any Code of Practice concerning the procurement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the procurement is conducted by an invitation to tender;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the following conditions are met—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that for every tender submitted for the procurement, whether it is accepted or not is decided by a corporation resolution; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that the voting-in-person threshold under paragraph 4 of Schedule 6C is met in relation to the passing of a corporation resolution for compliance with section 28F(2)(c) in relation to the procurement; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that for every tender submitted for the procurement, whether it is accepted or not is decided by an owners resolution; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that the voting-in-person threshold under paragraph 49 in relation to the passing of an owners resolution for compliance with sub-sub-sub-subparagraph (A) in relation to the procurement is met; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the contract is entered into with the tenderer whose tender is accepted as decided in the way mentioned in sub-subparagraph (c)(i)(A) or (ii)(A).

subsection.leadIn: Moreover, if there is no corporation—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the requirements relating to declarations specified in Subdivisions 1 and 2 of Division 4 must be complied with in relation to the procurement.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything to the contrary in a contract entered into for any large-scale maintenance procurement, the manager must not vary or terminate the contract unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if there is a corporation—

subparagraph.content: the contract is varied or terminated in accordance with a corporation resolution; and
the voting-in-person threshold under paragraph 4 of Schedule 6C is met in relation to the passing of a corporation resolution for compliance with section 28F(2)(d) in relation to the contract; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if there is no corporation—

subparagraph.content: the contract is varied or terminated in accordance with an owners resolution; and
the voting-in-person threshold under paragraph 49 is met in relation to the passing of an owners resolution for compliance with sub-sub-subparagraph (i) in relation to the contract.

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: See Division 4 of Part 3 of this Schedule for the specific procedure at meetings of owners concerning large-scale maintenance procurement.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Requirements for Tendering where there is No Corporation

section.name: s15
section.heading: Effect of Division 3
section.content: This Division has effect for the purposes of paragraphs 12(2)(a), 13(2)(a) and 14(2)(a).

section.name: s16
section.heading: Interpretation (Division 3)
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: deadline (入標期限), in relation to the submission of a tender for any procurement, means the time after which the submission may no longer be made under—(a)subject to sub-subparagraph (b), the terms of the invitation to tender issued for the procurement; or(b)if the invitation is revised—the terms of the revised invitation issued for the procurement.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Content of invitation to tender

subsection.leadIn: An invitation to tender issued for the procurement must set out clearly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the supplies, goods or services to which the procurement relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specified time on a specified day after which a tender may no longer be submitted for the procurement.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, subparagraph (1)(b) does not prevent the invitation to tender from containing any terms in respect of a postponement, for reasons such as inclement weather, of the time after which a tender may no longer be submitted for the procurement.
In this paragraph, a reference to an invitation to tender issued for the procurement includes, if applicable, any revised invitation to tender issued for the procurement.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Display of copy of invitation to tender

subsection.content: If an invitation to tender is issued for the procurement, the manager must display a copy of the invitation in a prominent place in the building as soon as reasonably practicable after the invitation is issued, and cause it to remain so displayed until the deadline for the submission of a tender for the procurement.

subsection.leadIn: If a revised invitation to tender is issued for the procurement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement under this paragraph to cause a copy of the previous version of the invitation to remain displayed in a prominent place in the building ceases to apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manager must display a copy of the revised invitation in a prominent place in the building as soon as reasonably practicable after the revised invitation is issued, and cause it to remain so displayed until the deadline for the submission of a tender for the procurement.

section.name: s19
section.heading: No acceptance of tender submitted after deadline
section.content: Any tender submitted for the procurement after the deadline must not be accepted.

section.name: s20
section.heading: No acceptance of tender without approval under certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subparagraph (4), no tender may be accepted for the procurement if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procurement is the procurement of any supplies, goods or services the value of which exceeds, or is likely to exceed, the monetary amount specified in paragraph 5(1)(a) of Schedule 6A, and an invitation to tender has not been specifically issued to 5 or more potential suppliers for the procurement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the procurement is the procurement of any supplies, goods or services the value of which—

subparagraph.content: does not exceed, or is unlikely to exceed, the monetary amount specified in paragraph 5(1)(b)(ii) of that Schedule,

paragraph.continued: and an invitation to tender has not been specifically issued to 3 or more potential suppliers for the procurement.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subparagraph (1), an invitation to tender is specifically issued to a person if it is issued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering a copy of the invitation in hard copy form personally to the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending a copy of the invitation in hard copy form by post, or by courier service, to the person at the person’s last known business address; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by sending validly a copy of the invitation in electronic form to the person.

subsection.content: Subparagraph (1) applies regardless of whether an invitation to tender issued for the procurement is advertised (such as in a local newspaper or on a website) and is open to any potential suppliers.
Subparagraph (1) does not have any effect in relation to the procurement if it is so decided by an owners resolution.
In this paragraph, a reference to an invitation to tender issued for the procurement includes, if applicable, any revised invitation to tender issued for the procurement.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Requirements Relating to Declarations where there is No Corporation

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Declarations of Interests or Connections etc. by Responsible Persons and Related Restrictions for Type 1 High-value Procurement, Type 2 High-value Procurement and Large-scale Maintenance Procurement

section.name: s21
section.heading: Effect of Subdivision 1
section.content: This Subdivision has effect for the purposes of paragraphs 12(2)(b), 13(2)(b) and 14(2)(b).

section.name: s22
section.heading: Declarations of dealings or connections with members of owners’ committee

subsection.content: If the manager becomes aware that, after the initiation decision is made for the procurement but before a contract is entered into for it, the manager has any pecuniary or other personal dealing with a member of the owners’ committee, the manager must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming so aware, declare the dealing in accordance with paragraphs 24 and 25.

If the manager becomes aware that, after the initiation decision is made for the procurement but before a contract is entered into for it, the manager has any connection with a member of the owners’ committee, the manager must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming so aware, declare the connection in accordance with paragraphs 24 and 25.

subsection.leadIn: If there is a responsible person for the procurement other than the manager, the manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must require the responsible person to comply with subparagraphs (1) and (2) that are to be construed as if a reference to the manager in those subparagraphs were a reference to the responsible person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must use the manager’s best endeavors to prevent any contravention of the requirement by the responsible person.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Declarations of interests or connections for tenders submitted

subsection.content: If the manager becomes aware that, before a contract is entered into for the procurement, the manager has any pecuniary or other personal interest in a tender submitted for the procurement, the manager must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming so aware, declare the interest in accordance with paragraphs 24 and 25.

If the manager becomes aware that, before a contract is entered into for the procurement, the manager has any connection with a person who has submitted a tender for the procurement, the manager must, as soon as reasonably practicable after becoming so aware, declare the connection in accordance with paragraphs 24 and 25.

subsection.leadIn: If there is a responsible person for the procurement other than the manager, the manager—

paragraph.name: a
