paragraph.content: must require the responsible person to comply with subparagraphs (1) and (2) that are to be construed as if a reference to the manager in those subparagraphs were a reference to the responsible person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must use the manager’s best endeavors to prevent any contravention of the requirement by the responsible person.

subsection.leadIn: If the procurement is conducted in the circumstances described in paragraph 12(3) or 13(3), then for the purposes of this paragraph—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reference to a tender submitted for the procurement in subparagraph (1) is to be construed as a reference to the procurement of supplies, goods or services from the specified supplier; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference to a person who has submitted a tender for the procurement in subparagraph (2) is to be construed as a reference to the specified supplier.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified supplier (指明供應商), in relation to the procurement of any supplies, goods or services conducted in the circumstances described in paragraph 12(3) or 13(3), means the supplier from whom the supplies, goods or services are to be procured under the decision mentioned in that paragraph.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Form of declarations

subsection.content: The declaration must be made in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: If a person who makes the declaration is a body corporate, then despite anything to the contrary in its constitution, the declaration must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impressed with its seal or chop; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: signed by a person authorized by it in that behalf.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Persons to whom declarations are made

subsection.leadIn: The declaration must be made to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to sub-subparagraph (b), the chairman of the owners’ committee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person who makes the declaration (declarant) is the chairman of the owners’ committee, or making the declaration under sub-subparagraph (a) is impracticable for reasons such as vacancy in an office—every member of the owners’ committee (not including the declarant in the case where the declarant is a member of the owners’ committee).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this paragraph, a declaration is made to a person if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a copy of the declaration in electronic form is sent validly to the person.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Display of notice of declarations

subsection.content: If a declaration under paragraph 22 or 23 has been made, the manager must display a notice of the declaration that complies with subparagraph (2) in a prominent place in the building within 7 days after the date on which the declaration is made, and cause it to remain so displayed for at least 7 consecutive days.

subsection.leadIn: The notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must identify—

subparagraph.content: the person who made the declaration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must specify in which of the following capacities the person made the declaration—

subparagraph.content: the manager of the building;
a person who is accustomed or obliged to act in accordance with the directions or instructions of the manager in connection with substantive matters in respect of the procurement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must contain a statement indicating the right to inspect a copy of the declaration under paragraph 28(2).

subsection.content: If a declaration is made to different members of the owners’ committee as required by paragraph 25(1)(b) and is so made on different dates, then for the purposes of subparagraph (1), the last such date is taken to be the date on which the declaration is made.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Specific meeting procedure relating to declarations

subsection.leadIn: If a declaration under paragraph 22 or 23 has been made, the manager must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a copy of a notice mentioned in paragraph 26(1) is attached to the minutes of the proceedings at the meeting kept under the deed of mutual covenant.

subsection.content: Subparagraph (1) does not limit any other terms of the deed of mutual covenant in relation to the procedure at a meeting of owners convened under the deed of mutual covenant.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: procurement meeting (採購會議), in relation to a declaration, means a meeting of owners convened under the deed of mutual covenant that concerns the relevant procurement.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Keeping of and permitting inspection of declarations

subsection.content: If a declaration under paragraph 22 or 23 has been made in relation to the procurement, the manager must, during the period of 6 years after the date on which a contract is entered into for the procurement, keep a copy of the declaration.
The manager must permit a specified person to inspect the copy at any reasonable time.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)an owner;(b)a registered mortgagee; or(c)any person duly authorized in writing by an owner or registered mortgagee to conduct an inspection mentioned in subparagraph (2).

section.name: s29
section.heading: Prohibition from participating in procurement activities

subsection.content: A person who has made a declaration under paragraph 22 or 23 in relation to the procurement must not participate in any assessment of tenders submitted for the procurement or any negotiation or other activity relating to the procurement.
A person mentioned in subparagraph (1) is exempt from that subparagraph if it is so decided by an owners resolution.
A resolution for exempting a person under subparagraph (2) (exemption resolution) must not be proposed at a meeting unless the reasons for proposing the resolution are given at the meeting.

The person presiding over a meeting at which an exemption resolution is proposed must ensure that the minutes of the proceedings at the meeting kept under the deed of mutual covenant contain the reasons mentioned in subparagraph (3).
This paragraph does not limit any other terms of the deed of mutual covenant in relation to the procedure at a meeting of owners convened under the deed of mutual covenant.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Declarations of No Interest or Connection by Responsible Persons for Large-scale Maintenance Procurement

section.name: s30
section.heading: Effect of Subdivision 2
section.content: This Subdivision has effect for the purposes of paragraph 14(2)(b).

section.name: s31
section.heading: Declaration of no dealing or connection with members of owners’ committee

subsection.leadIn: If the initiation decision has been made for the large-scale maintenance procurement, the manager must, before the first tender acceptance meeting is held, declare in accordance with paragraphs 33 and 34—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the manager, as at the date of the declaration—

subparagraph.content: if the manager has declared a dealing under paragraph 22(1)—does not have any pecuniary or other personal dealing with a member of the owners’ committee except for the dealing so declared; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the manager, as at the date of the declaration—

subparagraph.content: if the manager has declared a connection under paragraph 22(2)—does not have any connection with a member of the owners’ committee except for the connection so declared; or
in any other case—does not have any connection with a member of the owners’ committee.

subsection.leadIn: If there is a responsible person for the procurement other than the manager, the manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must require the responsible person to comply with subparagraph (1) that is to be construed in accordance with subparagraph (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must use the manager’s best endeavors to prevent any contravention of the requirement by the responsible person.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subparagraph (2)(a), subparagraph (1) is to be construed as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to the manager in subparagraph (1) were a reference to the responsible person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference to declaring a dealing under paragraph 22(1) in subparagraph (1)(a)(i) were a reference to declaring a dealing in compliance with a requirement imposed by the manager under paragraph 22(3)(a); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reference to declaring a connection under paragraph 22(2) in subparagraph (1)(b)(i) were a reference to declaring a connection in compliance with a requirement imposed by the manager under paragraph 22(3)(a).

section.name: s32
section.heading: Declaration of no interest or connection for tenders submitted

subsection.leadIn: If any tender has been submitted for the large-scale maintenance procurement, the manager must, before the first tender acceptance meeting is held, declare in accordance with paragraphs 33 and 34—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the manager, as at the date of the declaration—

subparagraph.content: if the manager has declared an interest under paragraph 23(1) in respect of the tender—does not have any pecuniary or other personal interest in the tender except for the interest so declared; or
in any other case—does not have any pecuniary or other personal interest in the tender; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the manager, as at the date of the declaration—

subparagraph.content: if the manager has declared a connection under paragraph 23(2) in respect of the tender—does not have any connection with a person who has submitted the tender except for the connection so declared; or
in any other case—does not have any connection with a person who has submitted the tender.

subsection.leadIn: If there is a responsible person for the procurement other than the manager, the manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must require the responsible person to comply with subparagraph (1) that is to be construed in accordance with subparagraph (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must use the manager’s best endeavors to prevent any contravention of the requirement by the responsible person.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subparagraph (2)(a), subparagraph (1) is to be construed as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to the manager in subparagraph (1) were a reference to the responsible person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference to declaring an interest under paragraph 23(1) in subparagraph (1)(a)(i) were a reference to declaring an interest in compliance with a requirement imposed by the manager under paragraph 23(3)(a); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reference to declaring a connection under paragraph 23(2) in subparagraph (1)(b)(i) were a reference to declaring a connection in compliance with a requirement imposed by the manager under paragraph 23(3)(a).

section.name: s33
section.heading: Form of declarations

subsection.content: The declaration must be made in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: If a person who makes the declaration is a body corporate, then despite anything to the contrary in its constitution, the declaration must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impressed with its seal or chop; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: signed by a person authorized by it in that behalf.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Persons to whom declarations are made

subsection.leadIn: The declaration must be made to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to sub-subparagraph (b), the chairman of the owners’ committee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person who makes the declaration (declarant) is the chairman of the owners’ committee, or making the declaration under sub-subparagraph (a) is impracticable for reasons such as vacancy in an office—every member of the owners’ committee (not including the declarant in the case where the declarant is a member of the owners’ committee).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this paragraph, a declaration is made to a person if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a copy of the declaration in electronic form is sent validly to the person.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Specific meeting procedure relating to declarations for first tender acceptance meeting

subsection.content: For every declaration that has been made under paragraph 31 or 32, the manager must ensure that a document in respect of the declaration that complies with subparagraph (2) is attached to the minutes of the proceedings at the first tender acceptance meeting kept under the deed of mutual covenant.

subsection.leadIn: The document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must identify—

subparagraph.content: the procurement and tender concerned; and
the person who made the declaration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must specify in which of the following capacities the person made the declaration—

subparagraph.content: the manager of the building;
a person who is accustomed or obliged to act in accordance with the directions or instructions of the manager in connection with substantive matters in respect of the procurement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must contain a statement indicating the right to inspect a copy of the declaration under paragraph 36(2).

subsection.content: Subparagraph (1) does not limit any other terms of the deed of mutual covenant in relation to the procedure at a meeting of owners convened under the deed of mutual covenant.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Keeping of and permitting inspection of declarations

subsection.content: If a declaration under paragraph 31 or 32 has been made in relation to the large-scale maintenance procurement, the manager must, during the period of 6 years after the date on which a contract is entered into for the procurement, keep a copy of the declaration.
The manager must permit a specified person to inspect the copy at any reasonable time.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)an owner;(b)a registered mortgagee; or(c)any person duly authorized in writing by an owner or registered mortgagee to conduct an inspection mentioned in subparagraph (2).

section.name: s37
section.heading: Application

subsection.content: This Part applies if there is no corporation.

subsection.leadIn: Paragraphs 40 and 41 and Division 3 do not apply in relation to a meeting of owners if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an original meeting—a notice of the meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an adjourned meeting—a notice of the original meeting,

subsection.continued: is given under the deed of mutual covenant before the date on which the Building Management (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (20 of 2024) comes into operation*.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Reference to meetings of owners
section.leadIn: In this Part (except paragraph 39), a reference to a meeting of owners—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a reference to such a meeting convened under the deed of mutual covenant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a meeting mentioned in sub-subparagraph (a) is adjourned—includes the adjourned meeting.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Notices of meeting

subsection.content: A person who convenes a meeting of owners under the deed of mutual covenant must, at least 14 days before the date of the meeting, give notice of the meeting to each owner.

subsection.leadIn: The notice of meeting must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date, time and place of the meeting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolutions (if any) that are to be proposed at the meeting.

subsection.content: If the meeting is adjourned, subparagraphs (1) and (2) apply in relation to the adjourned meeting as they apply in relation to the original meeting.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Minutes of proceedings at meetings

subsection.content: The manager must keep minutes of the proceedings at every meeting of owners.

The manager must display the minutes in a prominent place in the building within 28 days after the date of the meeting to which the minutes relate, and cause the minutes to remain so displayed for at least 7 consecutive days.
The manager must keep the minutes during the period of 6 years after the date of the meeting to which the minutes relate.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Supply of copies of minutes of proceedings at meetings

subsection.content: Subject to subparagraph (3), if a specified person requests, in writing, the manager to supply the specified person with a copy of the minutes of the proceedings kept under paragraph 40, the manager must supply the specified person with the copy within 28 days after the date on which the request is made.

subsection.leadIn: The manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may impose a reasonable copying charge for supplying the specified person with the copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not impose any charge for supplying the specified person with the copy in electronic form.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request mentioned in subparagraph (1) is a request for a copy in hard copy form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manager imposes under subparagraph (2)(a) a copying charge for supplying the specified person with the copy,

subsection.continued: the manager is not required to comply with the request unless the specified person pays the charge.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)an owner;(b)a registered mortgagee; or(c)any person duly authorized in writing by an owner or registered mortgagee to make a request mentioned in subparagraph (1).

division.name: D3
division.heading: Authorized Natural Persons for Corporate Flat Owners

section.name: s42
section.heading: Acting for corporate flat owners by authorized natural persons

subsection.content: A natural person authorized by a corporate flat owner under subparagraph (2) in respect of a meeting of owners may act for the corporate flat owner for the meeting.
A corporate flat owner may by written notice (authorization notice) given in accordance with subparagraph (4) authorize 1 natural person for the purposes of subparagraph (1).

Subparagraph (2) does not prevent a corporate flat owner from, after it has authorized a person as an authorized natural person in respect of a meeting of owners (original authorized natural person), authorizing another person as an authorized natural person in respect of the meeting in substitution of the original authorized natural person.

subsection.leadIn: The authorization notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be given in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must, despite anything to the contrary in the corporate flat owner’s constitution, be—

subparagraph.content: impressed with its seal or chop; and
signed by a person authorized by it in that behalf; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must be given to the person in charge of the meeting at least 48 hours before the time for the holding of the meeting—

subparagraph.content: by lodging the original of the notice in hard copy form with the person; or
by sending validly a copy of the notice in electronic form to the person.

subsection.leadIn: In subparagraph (4)(c), a reference to the person in charge of a meeting of owners is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the meeting is convened by the owners’ committee—the chairman of the owners’ committee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the convenor of the meeting.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Supplementary terms relating to authorized natural persons

subsection.content: An authorized natural person who attends a meeting of owners on behalf of a corporate flat owner under paragraph 42(1) is, for all purposes relating to the meeting, taken to be the corporate flat owner present at the meeting.

A corporate flat owner is, for all purposes relating to a meeting of owners, taken to cast a vote personally at the meeting if an authorized natural person casts a vote on behalf of the corporate flat owner at the meeting under paragraph 42(1).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: under another term of the deed of mutual covenant—

subparagraph.content: in the event that 2 or more persons are the co-owners of a share, the vote in respect of the share may be cast at a meeting of owners by a person appointed by any or all of the co-owners; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an eligible co-owner is a corporate flat owner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an authorized natural person is available to act for the eligible co-owner for the meeting,

subsection.continued: the authorized natural person is also eligible to be so appointed for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized natural person is available to act for a corporate flat owner for a meeting of owners—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the corporate flat owner has appointed a proxy for the meeting—the instrument appointing the proxy is regarded as revoked.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Effect of authorization of authorized natural persons for adjourned meetings
section.leadIn: If a meeting of owners is adjourned, a corporate flat owner’s authorized natural person for the original meeting is, for the purposes of the deed of mutual covenant, also taken to be the corporate flat owner’s authorized natural person for the adjourned meeting unless—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the original authorization notice is revoked; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the corporate flat owner authorizes another person under paragraph 42(2) in respect of the adjourned meeting.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Division 3 not preventing other mechanism under which natural persons may act for corporate flat owners under deed of mutual covenant
section.content: This Division does not prevent the deed of mutual covenant from containing any terms in respect of any mechanism, other than the one specified in this Division, by which a natural person may be authorized to act for a corporate flat owner for a meeting of owners.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Specific Procedure at Meetings of Owners Concerning Large-scale Maintenance Procurement

section.name: s46
section.heading: References to proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution
section.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to a proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution is a reference to a proposed resolution of the owners for deciding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a tender submitted for any large-scale maintenance procurement is to be accepted or not; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether a contract entered into for any large-scale maintenance procurement—

subparagraph.content: is to be varied or not; or
is to be terminated or not.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Deed of mutual covenant not limited unless inconsistent
section.content: This Division does not limit any other terms of the deed of mutual covenant in relation to the procedure at a meeting of owners to the extent that those terms are consistent with this Division.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Notices of meeting

subsection.content: If a resolution that is to be proposed at a meeting of owners is a proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution, the statement in the notice of the meeting specifying the proposed resolution for compliance with paragraph 39(2)(b) must be titled “Important Reminder” in English and “重要提示” in Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: If the proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution concerns the question mentioned in paragraph 46(a), the notice of the meeting must, in relation to each tender that is valid under the terms of the relevant invitation to tender, set out clearly and legibly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the estimated amount to be contributed from each building management fund for the procurement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the estimated apportioned amount that each of the owners is to contribute for the procurement in addition to a contribution mentioned in sub-subparagraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: If the proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution concerns a question mentioned in paragraph 46(b) and the owners are expected to incur any financial liability (including legal costs) because of the relevant variation or termination of contract, the notice of the meeting must set out clearly and legibly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the estimated amount to be contributed from each building management fund for settling the costs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the estimated apportioned amount that each of the owners is to contribute for settling the costs in addition to a contribution mentioned in sub-subparagraph (a).

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, even if the estimated amount mentioned in subparagraph (2) or (3) is zero, that subparagraph does require such an amount to be set out in accordance with that subparagraph.

subsection.leadIn: In this paragraph—
subsection.def: building management fund (建築物管理基金) means—(a)a special fund established and maintained by the manager under paragraph 4(1); or(b)any fund other than the special fund that is established and maintained by the manager for performing a function under the deed of mutual covenant or this Ordinance.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Voting-in-person threshold

subsection.content: The voting in respect of a proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution at a meeting of owners is subject to a voting-in-person threshold specified under subparagraph (2).

subsection.leadIn: The voting-in-person threshold is the lesser of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 5% of the owners; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 100 owners.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Recording of votes cast personally and by proxy
section.leadIn: If votes have been cast for a proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution at a meeting of owners, the manager must ensure that the minutes of the proceedings at the meeting kept under paragraph 40(1) contain a clear and legible record of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total number of such votes cast personally; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total number of such votes cast by proxy.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Supply of copies of minutes of proceedings at meetings
section.leadIn: If a proposed large-scale maintenance procurement resolution is considered at a meeting of owners, the manager must, within 28 days after the date of the meeting, supply each of the owners with a copy of the minutes of the proceedings at the meeting that are kept under paragraph 40—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering a copy of the minutes in hard copy form personally to the owner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending a copy of the minutes in hard copy form by post to the owner at the owner’s last known address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by leaving a copy of the minutes in hard copy form at the owner’s flat or depositing such a copy in the letter box for that flat; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by sending validly a copy of the minutes in electronic form to the owner.

schedule.name: sch8
schedule.heading: Terms Added if Consistent with Deed of Mutual Covenant

section.name: s1
section.content: A meeting of the owners’ committee may be convened at any time by the chairman or any 2 members of the owners’ committee.

section.name: s2
section.content: The person or persons convening the meeting of the owners’ committee shall, at least 7 days before the date of the meeting, give notice of the meeting to each member of the owners’ committee.

section.name: s2A
section.leadIn: The notice of meeting referred to in paragraph 2 shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date, time and place of the meeting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolutions (if any) that are to be proposed at the meeting.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: The notice of meeting referred to in paragraph 2 may be given— (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering it personally to the member of the owners’ committee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending it by post to the member of the owners’ committee at his last known address; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by leaving it at the member’s flat or depositing it in the letter box for that flat. (Amended 12 of 1998 s. 10)

section.name: s4
section.content: The quorum at a meeting of the owners’ committee shall be 50% of the members of the owners’ committee (rounded up to the nearest whole number) or 3 such members, whichever is the greater.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: A meeting of the owners’ committee shall be presided over by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairman; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of the chairman, a member of the owners’ committee appointed as chairman for that meeting.

section.name: s6
section.content: At a meeting of the owners’ committee, each member present shall have 1 vote on a question before the committee and if there is an equality of votes the chairman shall have, in addition to a deliberative vote, a casting vote.

section.name: s7
section.content: The procedure at meetings of the owners’ committee shall be as is determined by the owners’ committee.

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: A meeting of owners may be convened by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owners’ committee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manager; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an owner appointed to convene such a meeting by the owners of not less than 5% of the shares in aggregate.

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: A notice of a meeting of owners convened under the deed of mutual covenant may be given— (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 33; 20 of 2024 s. 44)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering it personally to the owner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending it by post to the owner at his last known address; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by leaving it at the owner’s flat or depositing it in the letter box for that flat. (Amended 12 of 1998 s. 10)

section.name: s11
section.content: The quorum at a meeting of owners convened under the deed of mutual covenant is 10% of the owners.

section.name: s11A
section.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph 11, the reference in that paragraph to “10% of the owners” shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be construed as a reference to 10% of the number of persons who are owners without regard to their ownership of any particular percentage of the total number of shares into which the building is divided; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not be construed as the owners of 10% of the shares in aggregate. (Amended 5 of 2007 s. 70)

section.name: s12
section.content: A meeting of owners convened under the deed of mutual covenant must be presided over by the chairman of the owners’ committee or, if the meeting is convened under paragraph 8(b) or (c), the person convening the meeting.

section.name: s13
section.leadIn: At a meeting of owners convened under the deed of mutual covenant— (Amended 20 of 2024 s. 44)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an owner shall have one vote in respect of each share he owns; (Replaced 5 of 2007 s. 33)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an owner may cast a vote personally or by proxy; (Replaced 5 of 2007 s. 33)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where 2 or more persons are the co-owners of a share, the vote in respect of the share may be cast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by a proxy jointly appointed by the co-owners;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by a person appointed by the co-owners from amongst themselves; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if no appointment is made under sub-subparagraph (i) or (ii), either by one of the co-owners personally or by a proxy appointed by one of the co-owners; (Replaced 5 of 2007 s. 33)

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: where 2 or more persons are the co-owners of a share and more than one of the co-owners seeks to cast a vote in respect of the share, only the vote that is cast, whether personally or by proxy, by the co-owner whose name, in order of priority, stands highest in relation to that share in the register kept at the Land Registry shall be treated as valid; and (Added 5 of 2007 s. 33)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if there is an equality of votes the person presiding over the meeting shall have, in addition to a deliberative vote, a casting vote.

subsection.leadIn: An instrument appointing a proxy shall be in the form set out in Form 1 in Schedule 1A, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be signed by the owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the owner is a body corporate, shall, notwithstanding anything to the contrary in its constitution, be impressed with the seal or chop of the body corporate and signed by a person authorized by the body corporate in that behalf.

subsection.content: The instrument appointing a proxy shall be lodged with the chairman of the owners’ committee or, if the meeting is convened under paragraph 8(b) or (c), the person convening the meeting at least 48 hours before the time for the holding of the meeting.
A proxy appointed by an owner to attend and vote on behalf of the owner shall, for the purposes of the meeting, be treated as being the owner present at the meeting.

section.name: s15
section.content: The procedure at a meeting of owners convened under the deed of mutual covenant is as is determined by the owners.

schedule.name: sch10
schedule.heading: Hearing and Determination of Specified Proceedings by Tribunal

section.name: s1
section.content: Proceedings relating to the interpretation and enforcement of the provisions of this Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.content: Proceedings relating to the interpretation and enforcement of the terms and provisions of a deed of mutual covenant, including such terms or provisions impliedly incorporated into a deed of mutual covenant under Part VIA.

section.name: s3
section.content: Proceedings relating to the use, occupation, enjoyment, possession or ownership of the common parts or any other part of a building in which the owners have a common interest.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: Proceedings relating to the calculation or apportionment of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any sums payable or purported to be payable under a deed of mutual covenant (if any);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the funds and contributions referred to in sections 20 and 21;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any management expenses or charges (howsoever named);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other outgoings, payments, debts or liabilities due or liable under this Ordinance or in accordance with the terms and provisions of an instrument which is registered in the Land Registry including a deed of mutual covenant (if any).

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: Proceedings relating to any question of law concerning the powers and duties of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a management committee, and of the chairman, secretary and treasurer thereof;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: an owners’ committee within the meaning of that section;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the tenants’ representative,

section.continued: including such powers and duties (if any) of a financial, pecuniary or fiduciary nature.

section.name: s6
section.content: Proceedings relating to any question of law concerning ownership, occupation or possession of the whole or any part of the building, including ownership or an undivided share in a building or in land on which there is a building.

section.name: s7
section.content: Without prejudice to paragraph 6 and subject to section 45(3), proceedings relating to any question of law concerning the extent and applicability or otherwise of any contractual or proprietory right enjoyed by owners and occupiers or otherwise referred to in the terms and provisions of an instrument which is registered in the Land Registry including a deed of mutual covenant (if any).

section.name: s8
section.content: Proceedings relating to any question of law concerning any breach or alleged breach of any covenant, term or condition specified in an instrument which is registered in the Land Registry including a deed of mutual covenant (if any).

section.name: s9
section.content: Proceedings relating to the enforcement of any contractual or proprietory right referred to in paragraph 7 or any covenant, term or condition referred to in paragraph 8, as the case may be, whether by way of specific performance, injunction, declaration, damages or otherwise.
